title: Question......Why is Lee Sin in every game?
body: Seems for a couple days now Lee Sin is in every single game. My games, games I see on various streams, friends' games. He is every where all of a sudden. Why the sudden surge in popularity? Did something happen to cause this that I'm not aware of?

replies.body: Riot buffed him for worlds and didn't renerf him
They also indirectly* buffed him with the jungle changes
Really? You mean he is better in this new jungle? I though it was better for farming junglers like Kayn, Yi and Shyvana. Personally, I find Shyvana plays alot better since the changes.

It’s a counterjungler meta more than anything else. It’s not the power farmers that win the hardest in this meta, it’s the champions that can deny the enemy farm and build a lead. 

But aside from that, lee is already an awfully fast jungler for being a “ganking jungler.” He has a huge passive attack speed steroid, a Q that lets him jump from camp to camp, and an AOE slam for waveclear. What he gives up in terms of speed he makes up for in his healthy clears with his W’s shield + lifesteal + spell vamp. 

He doesn’t need to outspeed the fastest junglers. He just needs to take their jungle a few times to put them behind, plus he _hopes_ he finds pretty much anyone not named udyr in the jungle, because he wins pretty much every 1v1 early.
Lower XP and gold hits all junglers pretty hard, power farming ones in particular. Lee and other early game gankers get stronger as a result of the others getting weaker from the change.
The bigger thing is mana junglers got hurt the most. You kinda have to use up a ton of mana to clear. Lee has energy, so he has nothing to worry about when it comes to being out of resources.

It's more about the laners who are complaining here. But is Lee sin more absurd than the stuff that is popular in the current meta? **NO.**

Lee Sin's balance is an interesting topic.  I argued for a long time that he's broken and has been for years.  After really studying him in games while climbing from silver 3 to almost plat these past few weeks (new account) I realize what it is.  It's not really that he's OP, it's just that in low elo people rely heavily on turrets, and he's very strong at diving early on.  

So I basically feel like it really throws off low elo people when this guy dives turret, jumps to teammate, or ward, gets that shield or w/e takes turret shots, kills, but is able to fly back out of there before that killing turret shot gets him...it just kind of shocks people.  So basically the only OP thing about him is his ability to dive early on and survive.  It's not really broken or unbalanced though because a lot of champs have this ability late game...he just has it early game instead.  He gets so weak later.  If you can make it to like 25 minutes he's already falling off.  So he needs a MASSIVE lead and to end fast.  

So I feel like he's just kind of Vayne's opposite...she can do insane things late as he can early.  A lot of champs are like this but those 2 are just really unbalanced at certain times of the game, but not unbalanced overall as champions.
